entry.title: MMTF 2019 - 55KM
entry.content:
After 1 year, I‚Äôm back to MMTF again, and this is also my only ultra race in 2019.
Well, I can say, this is my most unprepared ultra race, due to busy with works (and lazy üòÜ).

I reached run site at 6pm, from KL.

Is very crowded in race entry pack collection.

3 of us, 13KM, 25KM, 55KM (is me üòâ).

After collected race pack, they provide dinner there

Check the mandatory items checklist, then I only noticed

It‚Äôs Salomon, I thought it will be long lasting. But who knows, I only use a few times, in ultra race.
Initially I prepared total 1.5 litre of water, but now only left 1 litre ü§®

Race day

I arrived run site at around 7:40am, plan to buy a soft flask. But many booth not open yet.

This year start at morning, which I feel way better than last year (start at 9pm).
More fresh and not as tired as last year.

From starting point to CP1, I noticed 1 of my trekking pole cannot be locked.
So I only use 1 pole, and carry the other pole until CP1. My aunts and friends are helper in CP1,
then I just passed the unused pole to them. Of course, 2 poles are better, but no choice, I didn‚Äôt check earlier üòÖ

In CP1 here, the banana are whole piece, quite a lot of food there, but I only ate 1 banana, and don‚Äôt feel like eating much.

Not stop too long, and continue move on to CP2.

This year trail is much dry and not slippery compared to last year.

In this route, is quite tough for me, I guess probably is because I lack of training.

This is memorable place, last year I DNF here. I took 6 hours to reach this CP in 2018.
But this year, I took 4:40+ only. Also, the COT for this year is 6 hours, 30 minutes longer than last year (was 5:30 hours).

Hungry already. The banana are cut into half (in CP1 was whole piece).
I ate 1, then no more. LOL. Then I eat cake

From CP2 to CP3, is the longest, and toughest, so I think I need 1.5 litre of water.
But there didn‚Äôt have small bottle, ended up I need to carry the whole bottle, in hand, along the journey ü§¶

I was plan to DNF at CP3 (Angkasa), because I think, I totally no training for this race, it should be quite impossible to complete ü§î
So, I walk a while, sit and rest for a while, walk, sit, walk, sit‚Ä¶ for don‚Äôt know how many KM‚Ä¶

In around 900m elevation, I thought is reaching the peak soon, so I rest less, and keep walking. In fact, I walked for quite long time, then only reached

Finally, reached the TM tower, from here until CP4, all the way tar road ü§©

Refill with Nutrilite protein üòç

Walking in tar road is quite comfortable. Soon, reached CP3

Reached CP3, I have 2 hours buffer, so I think I should be able to finish the race.
Drink some hot coffee, eat some cake, then move on‚Ä¶

I think CP3 to CP4, I took around 2 hours, 10KM, all the way tar road, and going down hill

This is my dinner, it looks simple, but very delicious. Was very hungry

I took rest, and dinner around 30 minutes. Then depart again on 7:40pm.

Now CP4 to CP5 need headlamp already. And also going back to trail üò©

I started to feel tired again, some more night time hard to see.
The given time for this is 2 hours, but I have 1 hour+ buffer.
It took me about 2:30 hours to reach CP5.

CP5 is actually CP2, the same place. When reached CP5, there has no food, only drink, so I didn‚Äôt stop for long, because the time I feel like a bit tight.

From CP5 to finishing line, I saw the elevation profile, seems not very high.
In fact, I was super tired, and hiking up, even though is not that much of trail.

At the end, reached finishing line at 12:30am, total 16.5 hours, which is 30min before COT. Is quite hard to believe I make it, without training üòÇ

When reached finishing line, only get a medal, and a finisher T.
Nothing much else, and I straight away go back home, because really tired.
Long time didn‚Äôt push my body to such an extend.

Conclusion

Actually, this time I can complete, LUCK is 1 of the key, because the day before the race, has no rain, during the race day, no rain, and no hot sun, super nice weather.

I think, if raining that day, I may be DNF again. Thanks god üòå
entry.summary:
After 1 year, I‚Äôm back to MMTF again, and this is also my only ultra race in 2019.
Well, I can say, this is my most unprepared ultra

entry.title: 2019 Mount Ijen & Bromo Trip
entry.content:
This is my second time visiting Indonesia. Which also a hiking (or more accurately trekking) trip.

Day 1:

Wake up at 4:15am, take a 5am bus to KLIA2. Not sleep in the bus.

When reached KLIA2, meet-up with my aunt. After had some light breakfast, we proceed to baggage check in. I noticed now is self serve, have to weight the bag ourselves, scan the tag, and must make sure it match with the booking number. So, always reach airport earlier, we never know what will consume our time.

Everyone can fly

(Disclaimer: I‚Äôm not an affiliate of AirAsia)

When in the airplane, I not really sleep well, even though I was tired.

When reached Surabaya airport, The first thing I do is, connect airport WiFi üòÜ.
Then I saw a message from company üò©, what to do? So I still bought a SIM card there.

We met with the tour guide and follow the van (or bus, not sure) to Banyuwangi. I was told, to the destination need around 7 hours. That time was 11:30am. Then I expect should be around 8pm can reach the hotel, then we have around 3 hours+ to sleep.

Our first stop, is this restaurant, price range a bit higher on average, around Rp. 40k+ for a fried rice.

After don‚Äôt know how many hours, we stop by a rest area. Take a rest and take a walk.

Continue the journey, until‚Ä¶.. 7pm, the sky already dark, we were hungry, and stop by a mini market there, bought some biscuit & drink

Our dinner time was at 8pm, hungry, tired‚Ä¶

No fried rice, no fried noodle, only has economic rice.

The price is really economic, but the taste‚Ä¶ so so only‚Ä¶

Finally‚Ä¶ Arrived the hotel

From airport 11:30am, to the hotel 9:50pm üò± Super long journey

During the journey in the bus, is hard for me to sleep, and I not even sure if I had take a nap. Because of the shaky bus and narrow space.

The good news is, now we can rest; but, the not so good news is, we will be checking out on 12am üò®.
After shower and unpack some stuff, 10:30pm. 1.5 hours left. üò∞

Day 2

Alarm rang. 12am, I was super tired üò¥
After waiting all members ready, almost 1am. I think because of my tiredness, I‚Äôm able to nap for a while when travelling to Mount Ijen.

We were given a gas mask, for the sulphur smoke, which is very poisonous.

Is very crowded, and the trail was quite slippery. When hike down to the blue fire place, the trail is a bit dangerous.

We can see the fire, it just like the cooking gas fire. The smoke can make our throats dry and eye quite painful.
entry.summary: This is my second time visiting Indonesia. Which also a hiking (or more accurately trekking) trip.

entry.title: 2019 new year hike in Gunung Nuang
entry.content:
What people usually do in new year? Shopping, stay at home, etc.

This is not my first time hiking in 1st January.

I have been here 2 years ago, in Christmas day. Now come back again

We reached the entrance around 10:50am. Quite late and hot already.

To enter, have to register and pay RM2/person, I think is about the same as 2 years ago. Inflation affected here üòÜ

The beginning path, is highway, means car can pass through, wide & easy trail.

After about 5KM, then only reached the actual trail. We took around 1 hour+ to reach.

Begin to see waterfall here, there‚Äôs a way to turn and cross over the waterfall, after a short distance from the entrance.

Waterfall along the way. Here the elevation all the way up

There are few mini rivers, but cross over confirm shoes will get wet.

There‚Äôs a rope there, quite easy to cross over

Took 3 hours+, finally reached the Kem Pacat. 2 years ago I also hike until here.
Today also the same.

We took a short break here (around 15 minutes), eat some bread and have some energy drink.
It‚Äôs important to have some food & drink, to refuel üç© üç∏

I thought going down-hill should be faster, but end up, about the same like up-hill.

Here to wash face to cool down the heat (afternoon hike, heat is normal)

Finally, about 5 hours to come back the the highway, 4KM around 2 hours going down-hill.
Fast? Slow? Doesn‚Äôt matter, just enjoy the hike.

After the long highway‚Ä¶

Finally, we back the the entrance. Here‚Äôs after photo. Smile or cry ü§£

Remember to checkout when back to the entrance, they need to ensure everyone are safe.

Summary

Hiking can be one of the good choice in festive season

  • not as much people like shopping mall
  • strengthen our muscle
  • breath some fresh air outside of city

If you are first timer, and plan to go Nuang, you can try to go until Kem Pacat.

6 hours should be quite standard speed, and prepare

  • more water, 1.5 litre / person should be enough.
  • some food, no need too much, can be some energy food or bread good enough.

P/S: I‚Äôm not reached the summit, so I think 1.5 litre may not enough for some people if hike to summit, especially in hot weather.
entry.summary:
What people usually do in new year? Shopping, stay at home, etc.

This is not my first time hiking in 1st January.

I have

entry.title: MMTF 2018: 70KM
entry.content:
The only ultra race I joined in 2018. Also to support my hometown event.

This race is the first year organised, and mostly are virgin trail (now I know how‚Äôs the virgin trail look like).

My longest race before this, was 66KM in Chiang Mai.
So I think this year should upgrade a little bit.
From 66KM -> 70KM, 4KM extra, should be able to make it.

Look at the elevation profile

From the info given, the easiest path should be from starting point to CP1, seems like a flat road, and the toughest path should be the 2 big hill‚Ä¶

The story begin‚Ä¶

On 30th Nov 2018 (the race day), I woke up at 6:45am in the morning, then travel from KL to Taiping.
When the time reached Taiping, already 1pm+. Then go to collect race bib.

This time mandatory items check very strict, energy bar, glove, visor are required. Usual ultra trail race won‚Äôt check for these.

They provide 999 soap for 36KM & 70KM category, the soap is to prevent leeches.

The good thing about this race bib is, the elevation profile showing there. Convenient for runners.

Not many people attending the race briefing.
The race director has mentioned that, for 70KM runners, if in CP1 & CP2 already feel very tough, then should surrender to the crew in CP. Because from CP2 - CP3 will be 6 times tougher than CP1 - CP2.

From CP3 - CP4 will be tar road, all the way going down hill (I‚Äôve run there before in King of Bukit Larut).
This path cannot be run fast, if not, from CP4 - CP5 going up hill will be very tough‚Ä¶

Quite useful information in the briefing.

After the briefing, I went back to home and try to take a nap, unfortunatelyI can‚Äôt‚Ä¶

Before the race, take XS drink first, there‚Äôs some caffiene in this energy drink.

Met Baby Trail Running Club GM here.

There is heavy rain in around 8pm, luckily it‚Äôs getting lesser when close the race start at 9pm.

When start the race, is tar road, at beginning I thought the first 13KM is tar road.
But, it‚Äôs not, running I think few hundred meters already begin go into the trail.

I believe from race site to CP1 should be the easiest path throughout the whole course.
But you know what, to me, it‚Äôs quite tough at this point, the look-flat elevation doesn‚Äôt seems to match the reality‚Ä¶
I get ready a pair of hiking sticks, it really helps a lot, in both uphill & downhill.
From this path, there is a mix with trail & some tar road. The 13KM took me 2:47 hours.

At this point, I thought still early, and I didn‚Äôt notice the cut off time (COT) is 3 hours.
So I just slow & steady. Until‚Ä¶ The race director shout ‚Äúfaster! faster! still have 10 minutes!!‚Äù
Then I only notice, I‚Äôm 10 minutes before the COT. My first time ever, in CP1 didn‚Äôt have much time left (usually I will reach around 1 hour before the cut off).

Just continue to slow jog. Because from CP1 - CP2, the beginning path is tar road.
After I think around 1KM, we go into trail again, and this time tougher‚Ä¶
Until a point, I heard someone shout ‚Äúwrong way! wrong way!‚Äù, I just follow the front runners most of the time.
But when I heard this, I check with my GPS map, it really shows I‚Äôm out of the route, so have to U-turn back, I think around 100 meters, luckily is not too far yet‚Ä¶
So, here start going uphill, continuously‚Ä¶ And I begin to feel tired, sleepy.
I‚Äôm very bad in late-night running. Some more, I woke up so early in the morning and didn‚Äôt sleep in afternoon.
Then I keep stop and sit down (can‚Äôt remember how many times), really tired.
The ‚Äúgive up‚Äù start to popup in my mind. Then I keep telling myself, I must take a 10-15 minutes nap when I reached CP2.

The undertaker is coming up, because is close to the COT already.

The trail is very slippery & muddy. I holding 2 sticks is like doing skiing, but this is not snow, it‚Äôs mud‚Ä¶

I started to realise, the runners in front & behind of me are the same, means we‚Äôre in the same pace.
Until around 17KM, my headlamp getting darker, just last around 5 hours, then I change the battery in halfway.
When changing battery in dark, a bit difficult too. Because when turned off the headlamp, can‚Äôt see anything at all.
From here, I notice 1 set of spare battery is not enough, better to prepare 2 set spare battery for 1 night.

By this time, I heard some runner said ‚ÄúLagi 40 minit‚Äù, means 40 minutes left to the COT. And I still have 2~3KM‚Ä¶
Tired + sleepy, I know not enough time already, but still have to continue, because there‚Äôs no other way out to the trail.

I‚Äôm 35 minutes over the COT, my very first time DNF (did not finished), I also can‚Äôt imagine just in CP2, already DNF.
This race, need to train very well, not only lower body, upper body also need to train well.
There are some path has rope for us to pull. Also I know the importance of glove.

There are Coke, 100plus, Spritzer mineral water, & banana provided there.

I‚Äôm not the last 1 to reach CP2.

There are more runners coming.

Take Bodykey while waiting for the 4 wheels car.

I think this is my 2nd time to reach the finishing line so early (1st time was Penang Triathlon 2015).

From my shoes, already can know how muddy it is.

Some photos & videos from friends

Race statistics

CategoryRegisteredStartFinisherDNSDNF
70KM471395206 (52.2%)76189
36KM614491190 (38.7%)123301
15KM322242194 (80%)8048
Overall14231128590 (52.3%)295538

Summary

This is the toughest race I ever join, also the toughest hill I ever hike. Way more difficult than Mount Rinjani.

Compare this with Cameron ultra, if we call this a trail race, then Cultra I can consider it as a road race.
Because I not actually train well also can complete Cultra 55KM.
I can say Cultra very easy.

Compare this with Penang ECO, which previously I tought is toughest. This time is few times tougher than Penang ECO.
I did Penang ECO 50KM last year, is my first trail ultra, I not really train well also. I took 18 hours to complete.
Penang ECO has longer time, and the trail is not so muddy like this.
I can rate the Penang ECO difficulty level medium.

Probably I will try again in 2019 (I heard there will be a 50KM category). Should be try-able üòâ

Items/Gears I used in this race

Get from Lazada

Get from Lazada

Get from 11street

Get from Lazada

Get from 11street

Get from 11street

Get from 11street

Get from Lazada

Get from Lazada

Get from Lazada

Get from Lazada
entry.summary:
The only ultra race I joined in 2018. Also to support my hometown event.

This race is the first year organised, and mostly are

entry.title: Pong Yaeng Trail 2017 - 66km
entry.content:
This is the very first time I travel to foreign country alone. Also my first race in outside of Malaysia.

The why

After my first ultra 50km in Sungai Lembing back in 2016, I was thought of increase the distance.
But then I know, I‚Äôve no enough time to do much training, so I don‚Äôt plan to go for 100KM.

I found this race in Facebook, and it has 66KM category, which fulfill my requirement. Then I decided
to go alone (travel alone was one of my reason too)

What I have done before the race

In September 2017, my last trail running (about 8KM) before the race. Until 15 October, I joined
road race 30KM, I think this consider my LSD before the race, the result was bad, but a good LSD
for my leg to get used to long distance. In between, I totally no run/jogging at all.

Pre-race

I arrived Chiang Mai Internation Airport on 2nd Nov morning.

I took Grab car to the hostel, rest for 1 day before going to race.

Then travel around the nearby area by bicycle for the whole afternoon.

Of course, foot massage is a must!!

The event period

Race pack collection

I waited the shuttle van in Arcade bus terminal.

Because the hotel nearby the race venue already full, thus I only book the camp site

With the help of the other 2 runners‚Ä¶

Just walking distance

Yeah!! My lucky number

Not finish yet :)

One of my favourite brand

This is what they provide for dinner

The race day

My category started from 8am, I wake up at 5am++

Actually, this suppose to be my breakfast, but I wake up too early. Thus this won‚Äôt last so long for my stomach.

From the QSBG to the starting point, actually have about 1-2KM distance, thus I waited at the gate there,
and follow someone (stranger) car go up.

I felt hungry before the race, thus I order the fried instant noodle.
They wanted to treat me (because I only have THB1000 and they don‚Äôt have small change), ended up I manage to change
with another runner, and paid for the meal. Is very hard to find such a good heart guy.

I guess you know who‚Äôs this right? It‚Äôs Super sayan Goku :)

I think is not easy to wear such a costume and run for 66KM‚Ä¶

At the beginning, we start from road

I used 46 minutes to complete 4.95KM. Quite slow though

Quite a short CP, the next station around 3KM only

No rush, just enjoy the race. Be present‚Ä¶

Can see from here, the trail is not tough at all, it‚Äôs kind like a road run.

One thing I like about trail ultra is, there will be many villeges to cross through, and see their living

Reached CP2

Scanning the bib

The food give really nice, here‚Äôs the pineapple, and already cutted into piece.
I never seen this in Malaysia race so far.

Begin the journey again, it‚Äôs very hot, steep. But again, the trail (or road, I don‚Äôt know) is pretty easy

Aiming for podium is always not my style üòÜ

Yeah, still early

The food given, it‚Äôs pork rice, non-halal food. This won‚Äôt happen in Malaysia race

Finally, here look like trail already.

Come back to road again

About 5 hours passed, 42KM left

Very nice service

I have my own, Nutrilite. To fill up the protein, mineral & vitamin

I think for normal travellers, won‚Äôt come to this villege if they visit Chiang Mai.
This is why I like about trail ultra.

Reached A4

I‚Äôve never seen this in Malaysia race too.

Finally, reached the drop bag station.

Hmm‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm about the same pace with Goku. Am I fast?

See the runner in front? She‚Äôs another Malaysian who join the 66KM category.
66KM only she & me, 2 Malaysian.

From A3 to A2, I follow other runners, and turned into wrong way,
I think wasted about 20~30 minutes there.

That time I still don‚Äôt know how to use Suunto for navigation, although I loaded the route into it.

Somewhere in the middle, the wind very strong, and it sound like ghost crying, and the grass very tall, a bit scary feeling üò±

But it‚Äôs really awesome experience to me ‚úåÔ∏è

Here is very cold, eat some hot food really fantastic, they provide Laksa here too.

Reached the last CP already, 11KM left. I stay for quite short time here, and then continue moving to finishing line.

Reached the gate of the garden already. Tired and excited ü§©

Although reaching soon, but again, I gone into wrong route again.
The funny thing is, there‚Äôs another runner follow me üòÜ
So both of us running in the dark, and no other runners, no car, just a complete dark road (not trail).

After some point, I felt something not right, how come no other runners here?
Then I decided to make a U-turn, and that time I was far in front of the unlucky runner.
Until I saw him, I told him ‚Äúmai cai thini‚Ä¶‚Äù with my broken Thai language üòÖ

I think also wasted about 20~30 minutes here.

Then finally, I was 30 minutes before the DNF. I think that time was around 12:30am GMT+7.

The medal is handmade by their local people there, so special.

After race

The story not end yet‚Ä¶

I was stay in the tent previously, suppose after the race, I have to go back to the tent, and bath for cold water (night time really super cold).

But, remember the Malaysian runner same category to me?
They rented a resort, and I just follow her to the resort üòÅ
Super friendly, and very comfortable, especially after a long race.

Have nice bed, nice shower

I took the photo in the morning.

Summary

For those newbie who want to try out ultra, can try this, because so far I think this is the easiest trail ultra I‚Äôve ever join.

The organiser, the food given, is quite good. If you have more budget, better to rent a hotel or resort. Because it‚Äôs really awesome to rest nicely after a long race üòâ
entry.summary: This is the very first time I travel to foreign country alone. Also my first race in outside of Malaysia.

entry.title: My 1st Solo Night Trail Run
entry.content:
Why I have this thought? Probably I can say is some stress & thinking chaos. Last night I have less than 5 hours of sleep, and some other issues caused me to rush here rush there. Also, skipped lunch and went for a seminar (to duty).

Hungry‚Ä¶ Tired‚Ä¶ Cold (the air cond)‚Ä¶ Other things on hand‚Ä¶ I can‚Äôt get my mind cleared. Thus, I decided to try something I never done before ‚Äî‚Äî have a short run in Bukit Gasing.

Before that, I was thinking whether to go or not, or just take a rest‚Ä¶ Then I know the FEAR is stopping me, my little voice is stopping me‚Ä¶ I know the principle is, the more you fear, the more you must go for it! YES üí™ , then I go back and change clothes, bring my Black Diamond headlamp, change to trail running shoes, just as minimal as possible.

Of course, I put Allano lotion in my body, because I know there will have a lot of mosquito

Then, I went Bukit Gasing after having my dinner.

No one is hiking there, and is very dark inside the trail. Not complete dark because of moonlight

After taken some photos, I run in straight away. Because if I doubt for longer time, the bigger fear I have!

I follow the usual route that I know, because too many routes inside (I get lost a few times when I was hiking in the morning). Night time none of single person is inside other than me, so I must be very be careful, because if I get lost, no one will point me the correct direction.

Of course, I have some experience running in the dark in trail, during ultra trail event. But this is different, no one in front of me; no one behind of me; no one in left or right besides me, quite scary also.

During the run, I felt a bit tired when going up hill. But I didn‚Äôt stop at all, at most is slow down a bit, my mind is pretty clear, only one thing ‚Äî‚Äî to get out of the trail. I didn‚Äôt turn my head left or right, not even turn back, I don‚Äôt care what is behind me, I only look in front, 1 meter in front, seldom look further distance. What I take care of is, 3~4 steps in front of me. From here, I understand a word ‚Äî‚Äî FOCUS. I seldom so focus before. Is the FEAR make me focus, make me neglect of pain & tire‚Ä¶

Once I get out of the trail, I felt relieved. Once I reached home, I felt relax~ Really a great experience from this.

After workout, sure need to take protein for faster recovery

#nutrilite #salomon #suunto #compresssport #blackdiamond
entry.summary: Why I have this thought? Probably I can say is some stress & thinking chaos. Last night I have less than 5 hours of sleep, and some

entry.title: cameron-ultra-trail-2017-55km
entry.content:
Few months back, I was thinking whether to sign up for TMMT or Cultra. The reason for TMMT is because of the 70KM category (I wanted to try longer than 50KM, but shorter than 100KM), ended up I decided to sign up Cultra. I was attracted by the nice scenary.

Jul 21, 2017 (Friday)

This time also the same, I drove up to Cameron alone, and meet up my friend there. Initially I worried I‚Äôm not able to reach the race kit collection place before it closed, so I passed all the documents to my friend.

But when I reached there, is about 5pm (closed at 6pm). So I quickly get the documents from him and collect myself.

Can see long queue in the registration counter.

When I reached the mandatory items checking counter, I noticed I lost my blinker, then I quickly borrow 1 from my friend and pass through the checking.

Reminder for you, keep all the mandatory items inside zip-compartment.

After done everything, I drove to homestay to meet up with friends and go for dinner.

Eat steamboat in such a cold weather, really cool~

Jul 22, 2017 (Saturday)

I woke up at 3am (the race started at 5am), and eat Bak kut teh as breakfast üòÇ . One of the team member prepare this, and is my first time to eat Bak kut teh before the race. Very nice experience.

Then we carpool to the race site.

And start at 5am sharp!!

Race

I heard some of my friends said, we must run fast at the beginning, because in the trail is at the beginning, and will jam like hell. Then I run with a normal speed, and still stuck in the traffic jam‚Ä¶

When I reached CP1, the distance was 7.39KM, and the time was 1hr 12min. I just refill water and continue to move

When I reached CP2, the distance was 10.94KM, and the time was 2hr 13min. Around 1 hour for 3KM distance, can see how the traffic was. By the time already 7am+, already bright.

Same, I drink some soft-drink, refill water and continue to move on.

This CP also take longer time, 16.49KM, and the time was 4hr 03min. Because was in trail‚Ä¶ Again, I did the same thing, drink soft-drink, refill, go toilet and move on‚Ä¶

Now onwards, the path become easier

I didn‚Äôt take too long to rest in CP4 too, this CP has orange, so I take some orange (because started to feel hungry) and refill some water.

From here onward, not much trail, thus I pour out some tiny stones from my shoes.

Can see from CP4 to CP5, the path was not that tough, just the weather a bit hot, due to high altitude and the UV higher.

I really hungry at this moment, I asked the volunteer: ‚ÄúBro, pisang ada tak?
‚Äú (I asked for banana). ‚ÄúPisang tak ada, biskut pisang ada.‚Äù (only banana snack), LoL~

No choice, so just refill water and move on‚Ä¶ Because from CP5 to CP6 only 2.8KM.

Also, I take 1 set Double X & 2x glucosamine, as I started to feel my knee not very comfortable.

So happened that there‚Äôs a cafe halfway, I heard a sound ‚ÄúLim‚Ä¶ Lim‚Ä¶‚Äù, then I turned my head‚Ä¶ Omg!! is Kenny, my friend. Then I went up and have a small slice of chocolate cake (very tasty), and a sausage bread. It was one of my greatest lunch on this trip.

Immediately right after I finished the food, then I move on again, because 14 hours for 55KM trail run, is some how quite tight (for a beginner).

Very soon, reached CP6, so far completed 30KM, and 12pm at that moment.

There are lot‚Äôs of runner in this CP. I just refill water, put in Phytopowder in 1 of water bag (500ml), and move‚Ä¶

The best view of this race should be here. No matter how I snap, also nice‚Ä¶

Great!! This is the drop bag CP (for 55KM category), I thought there are some nice food here‚Ä¶

Cup noodle (spicy flavour) was provided, of course, there are coffee & tea as well. But I don‚Äôt felt like want to eat hot spicy food during the race, thus I skip the lunch provided. Luckily I have drop my secret food here üòè .

Refilled nutrition that body needs. Fantastic!!!

Then I changed my T-shirt as well, and take out my jacket. The used T-shirt put back to drop bag, and jacket put in my hydration bag, just in case‚Ä¶

I met 2 of my friends here, but I didn‚Äôt wait for them, as my speed was slow, I‚Äôm pretty sure they will chase me up afterward. So I move on‚Ä¶

About 1~2KM, I notice I left my race bib on CP7, oh shit!!!! What can I do??? I tried to call Kenny, tried to get the phone number of the 2 friends just now. But not in‚Ä¶ The only thing I can do now is, U-turn back to the CP7 üò≠ ‚Ä¶

Thanks god, still here‚Ä¶ I took off because of changing T-shirt, omg‚Ä¶

Then I move on immediately, at this moment my mood level down a bit, I think at least 20~30 minutes wasted‚Ä¶ What to do?

I walked all the way up back to CP6, so under the hot sun.

When I reached CP6, I felt so tired, thus I refilled water and take a couple of minutes of break here.

Same thing, I walked all the way to CP5. Because my leg felt a bit painful‚Ä¶

This is really a long long path! Getting less and less runners here, so I walked alone back to CP4.

Also, I consumed 1 set of Double X & 1x Co Q10, to fill up some nutrition for my body.

2 hours 50 minutes left. Same thing, refilled water here, but the orange was finished. So just move, because the remaining time getting shorter, and I afraid not able to complete within the cutoff time.

Just about start to run, Kenny called my name. He told me 6KM left, gambateh~ And I‚Äôm the last 1 (among our team members) until this CP. So just run lah!!

After 1KM+ of slow jog, my leg really painful, so I switch to ‚Äúwalk mode‚Äù üòÖ ‚Ä¶

Just kept walking‚Ä¶ Until the last part of trail, which is going up hill few hundreds meter elevation. In this part, my leg felt better when up hill, I also don‚Äôt know why. So I overtake some runners here, including one of my team member (met at CP7 that guy), he asked for chocolate from me, and I just finished it. LoL~

So I didn‚Äôt stop, and keep walking, until CP3, I saw not much volunteers there, and the gate also closed, then I didn‚Äôt stop as well, because about 1KM left to the finishing line.

Walk‚Ä¶ jog‚Ä¶ walk‚Ä¶ jog‚Ä¶ Finally‚Ä¶

Yeah!!! The official time is 12 hours 40 minutes. After couple of minutes, the guy ask for chocolate from me, also reached, without rest, another friend came, and asked both of us get up to the car, we went back to homestay!

If a picture worth of thousand words, then a video must worth for million words. Watch the video below:

Here is my official result, and certificate

Summary

This is my second trail race, the first 1 was Penang ECO 100 (of course I went for 50KM category). If you ask me, Penang ECO 100 VS Cameron Ultra Trail, which 1 more challenging? I would say, Penang ECO is 2x harder than Cameron Ultra Trail:

  1. There are more trail in Penang ECO.
  2. The starting time of Penang ECO 50KM started at 12am, I can said I almost no sleep before that; whereas, Cameron Ultra Trail 50KM started at 5am, at least I still have few hours of sleeping time.

Even though Penang ECO has longer hours (20 hours COT).

A lesson learned here, must always prepare sufficient food for the race. Because is hard to guarantee the organiser provide the food that we needed/wanted.

Nutrition/food taken during the race:

  • 2x Nutrilite All Plant Protein
  • 1x Nutrilite BodyKey Meal Replacement (Chocolate)
  • 2x Nutrilite Double X
  • 2x Nutrilite Glucosamine
  • 1x Nutrilite Co Q10
  • 4x Nutrilite Phytopowder (Orange)
  • 3x Snickers

PM me if you interested about the nutrition :)
entry.summary:

  position: relative;
  padding-bottom: 56.25%;
  padding-top: 30px; height: 0; overflow: hidden;
}

entry.title: Penang ECO 100 2017 - 50KM
entry.content:
This was the hardest race I‚Äôve ever join, also the longest hours race to me (until today). Here is the route:

After came back from Penang Triathlon, I rest for a while, and the training I‚Äôve done only 3x 10km road & 1x 5.3km trail.

I should said I have not prepared (at all), that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm so worried.

The day before (12th night), I have a meeting until 11:30pm, and also not sleep well. The next day morning I drove back to Perak first, but then there was an accident that cause the traffic jam (around 2 hours stuck there).

Once I reached home already 3pm, then 8pm drove to the race site, quite tired actually.

I reached the race site

Race pack collection

I thought it was 50km, in fact it was 54.6km‚Ä¶ (4.6km in trail is like 10km in road)

See the blue tape on my knee? The tape was quite useful when come to the trail run. I bought it few months ago, and I actually forgotten how to tape it on my ankle, so I call the seller who is a physioteraphist, and he immediately send me the video while he was driving. LoL‚Ä¶ Really thanks him very much

Everytime there is a briefing before the race

Must jot down the number in case need any help. Also there is a private taxi service, RM60/trip, but I only carry RM50 with me üòÖ .

Start soon, but I already felt sleepy üò¥ Still have to continue any how.

The 50KM start from CP5. From CP5 to CP6 about 9.8KM. The trail is quite tough, because is too dark, so no photo here.

The mud make the route slippery, up & down also not easy. Thus, when I reached CP7, already 2am

2 hours for 9.8KM, the cutoff is at 4am, means I‚Äôm 2 hours ahead. After take some drink & banana, then move on. The next CP is 10.1KM. Guess how long I take?

Probably from CP6 ~ CP7 is the toughest part in the race. A lot of up hill, also a lot of down hill, and steep. When I facing up hill, I kept resting, due to my heart beat very fast, and headache, and sleepy, and very tired‚Ä¶

Then I started to think, should I just slowly walk over to the next CP, and DNF? So I was planning to give up already, because really not feeling well that time.

After reached the road (I thought going to be road afterwards), I check the time, which already 3am, and I asked a runner beside me, he told me we have hiked around 1KM from CP6‚Ä¶ üò± That means 1KM took us 1 hour??? OMG!!

Want to call taxi? NO! There is middle of hill, shouldn‚Äôt have taxi to come up I guess. So‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs continue to walk‚Ä¶

I also don‚Äôt know how many KM, then going down hill, and it‚Äôs road üôÉ I was so happy and walk down.

WOAH~~~ Finally, 5:50am already. It took me almost 4 hours for this 10.1KM

So I refill water, take some fruits, consume some Nutrilite supplement. Then I saw some runners sleep there (there is a basketball court), so I also slept for a moment (not really sleep also, just for my mind & eye to rest).

The moment when I woke up is already 6:30am, but I felt fresh and energized üí™ . So I started to run slowly, the 6.7KM along the way is road, so great!!

Have great scene along the way

Reached CP8 at 7:35am. The next CP is 7.9KM away, not too far, not too near also‚Ä¶

After CP8, going to trail again‚Ä¶ I was scared, so just continue to walk, no more run here üòÖ

You can see is getting up hill here

My thigh is quite painful now. But the next CP only 3KM away. so sit for a moment and continue~

The 3KM trail‚Ä¶ like this

Reached CP10 at 12:22pm, which took me about 1.5 hour.

In this CP, they provide main food like fried noodle and nasi lemak. I heard some of the runners said want to give up, actually still have time. But I think may be they are too tired. One of the runner even said this is harder than TMBT. Again, I consumed Nutrilite supplement here again üòé

Well, I‚Äôm pretty confident that I‚Äôm able to finish it now. Move on‚Ä¶

This is the hottest time now, I somehow felt dehydrated. Hike until halfway, I started not feeling well again. So I sit down and closed my eye, rest my mind, for about 5 minutes. Surprisingly, I felt refresh again. COOL~~

I think probably is my luck this time, the sky suddenly turn dark, is like going to rain soon. But until I reached CP11, still no rain. Really nice weather, awesome!!

I reached CP11 at 3:30pm, still 4.5 hours to reach the finishing line, about8.1KM. Pretty much time now. So I take my time, and rest here.

I started to walk at 3:45~3:50pm, again‚Ä¶

The path mostly like this, pretty easy to go. Of course, there are up & down hill as well.

YEAH üôå ‚úåÔ∏è üòé finally I reached the finishing line‚Ä¶ My watch showing the time 6:10pm! The feeling was really awesome!! First time ever I run (hike) such a long hours, compared the my previous record, was 10hr 40min. Really really a big breakthrough to myself.

And here is the official result

Summary

As I mentioned above, this was my first time every to run such a long hours, and I was not prepared well for it too. So I learned that, take a nap can actually recover some energy. Of course, with the help of Nutrilite supplement too.

Before the race start, I consumed 1 sachet protein & 1 sachet of BodyKey meal replacement, plus Double X, B, E, Q10 & Glucosamine. My body status was: 56.8kg, 13.2% body fat, BMI 17.5, 1.5% visceral fat.

During the race, CP6CP7, CP9CP10, CP10CP11, CP11finishing line, each path I consume 1 sachet Phytopowder orange, to reduce the chance of cramp.
At CP7 & CP10, I consumed Double X 1-set, E & Glucosamine.

After the race, I consumed 2 sachets of protein, Double X, B, E, Q10 & Glucosamine, Cal Mag D. Then after a day, I checked my body with Karada scanner: 57.1kg, 9.7% body fat, 17.6 BMI, 1.0 visceral fat.

How great is this, after the race I still gain some weight üòé

I guess this would be my toughest race in 2017. Probably I won‚Äôt join again if without proper training.

entry.title: Penang Triathlon 2017
entry.content:
Before I sign up for this, my bicycle was parking at home for long long time, I think, since I already bought the bicycle, then I must go for race. Otherwise will be wasted. Thus, I signed up.

I think this is my lucky number.

After race bib collection, there is a dinner & briefing at the night before the race. I met a few friends during briefing. One of them asked me, ‚ÄúHow was your training?‚Äù I told him, ‚ÄúI almost no prepare for it, due to busy of work.‚Äù

It‚Äôs true, that‚Äôs why I said before sign up, I was considering‚Ä¶

Before the race, I did only 1x pool swimming üèä (about 1km I guess), 2x cycling üöµ (23km & 15km), running also stopped for few weeks after TITI ultra 50k.

I noticed the cutoff time was 5 hours. Because last year (PGiTD 2016) was 5:30 hours‚Ä¶ so I was a bit worry about that. Last year my result was almost 5 hours, and also, I did more training compare to this year. So? Theoritically I suppose to take longer time to complete the course than last year right?

One of my buddy that I met him in PGiTD 2016, he told me to enjoy the race. Wow~ so I got it‚Ä¶ Let‚Äôs enjoy it

Race day

Early morning I went to the race site from Bayan Lepas, so I 4:30am depart, as it took about 1 hour to travel from the place I stay. Then I reached at 5:30am, so I still have some time to get my bike ready, drink protein & bodykey, take some supplements‚Ä¶ That‚Äôs my light breakfast

Then went to check in the bike

The blue XDS is mine

Then have to walk about 500 meters to take the shuttle bus to the swim site.

Swim

This is the place where we hang our transition bag according to our bib number

The swimming part is divided into 2 loops, 750 meters each. During the first loop, so many swimmers was kicking here and there‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm not so used to it, and then I slow down and let others go first‚Ä¶

2nd loop, was smoother as getting less and less swimmers already.

When I get up, I heard someone said they get stung by jellyfish üò± . Luckily I don‚Äôt‚Ä¶

After swim, we have to run about 2.5km back to the transition area to take our bike (is a bit different from other triathlon)

According to the organiser, this is the shortcut that ready for us to get there. Lol

So long‚Ä¶

So hot‚Ä¶

And‚Ä¶ few hundred meters left to get the bicycle‚Ä¶

Bike

The cycling part was in the hill, up and down (about 10km I guess). The GO way, beginning was up hill, not that tired actually, not so steep also. It‚Äôs fun when going down hill. Then in kampung area about 10km also, is flat road.

Then the challenging part has come‚Ä¶ After U-turn to the BACK way, when I reached the up hill‚Ä¶ hmmm‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs like hell! So damn tired, my leg. I felt like very long hours there, and very long journey!!! But, I didn‚Äôt stop along the way, I just keep telling myself, later down hill is my rest time. When I reach the down part, thanks god! I can rest now~

Run

We run with a very nice view.

The tough part is, I run under hot sun, around 10:30am++ ~ 11am++. It‚Äôs hard to run, because of dehydration.

The lucky part is, every 2 ~ 3km has a water station.

The last station, we were given bananas

When I said, enjoy the race

Completed

When I cross the finishing line! Of course, the first thing to do is, take photo ‚úåÔ∏è

The medal

Total time: 4:23:17 ‚úåÔ∏è

Not so bad right?

Enjoy the race! Enjoy the pain!
entry.summary: Before I sign up for this, my bicycle was parking at home for long long time, I think, since I already bought the bicycle, then I must

entry.title: TITI ultra 2017 - 50KM
entry.content:
I‚Äôve been rest a while from race after PBIM 2016. Thus, I have a bit tension before the race. Another thing is, I have not much training, usually just 10k on weekend. But I have confidence to complete within cut off time :)

This is what I prepared for the race.

I dinner at 7pm, about 6 hours before the race. I ate maggi goreng chicken chop, quite a large portion. Until 10pm, I drink 2 scoops of All plant protein, Double X 1 set, Salmon Omega 3 one, get myself prepared.

I arrived race site at 11pm, went there early as I not very sure about the location, also not sure how long the mandatory items check it takes.

Lot‚Äôs of people over there already. Just the time I reached there, one of the 250KM runner just left the check point (the runner completed 200KM, left 50KM to go). A little while, the champion of 200KM runner arrived, he is really awesome, completed in 29hr++.

Before the race we have a briefing, I heard the director said that some participants don‚Äôt bring torch light/headlamp, which not fulfill the mandatory items requirement. This is not a usual marathon, thus it has specific requirements.

50KM category started at 1am, and the cut off is 10am.

Starting of the race, it‚Äôs raining, then I put my headlamp under my cap (because I read the review that black diamond headlamp is not waterproof).

From start until CP1 (9KM), my average pace is around 6-7 min/km, I just take 2 pieces of watermelon & 2 small cups of soft-drink.

Then continue to CP2 (in KM 14.5), using about the same pace like CP1, which I felt quite a short distance :)

Actually I didn‚Äôt know there is a cut off time for every CP, because in King of Sungai Lembing, there is only 1 cut off in one of the CP. But still, I was 45 minutes ahead the cut off :)

The challenge comes up in KM 18‚Ä¶ I felt a bit hard to breathe, and my heart not feeling comfortable as well. I open up the 2 clips of my hydration bag, and started to walk in average speed. I kept looking for the next CP, unfortunately I didn‚Äôt see any‚Ä¶ still in complete dark in front of me (because CP area has some lights)

Until KM 22-23, the road is downhill, then I run a little bit, walk-run-walk-run‚Ä¶ Finally saw CP3, which is in KM 25, the U-turn point.

I rest in the CP3 for around 30 minutes. I ate 2 bananas, a few pieces of watermelons and refill some water. After rest, I felt better, then continue to run 4KMs, because I know that from CP3 to CP4 (now going backward) is 10.5KM, so I still have a lot of time. Then I continue to walk-run-walk-run‚Ä¶

In KM 32, I felt hungry already, then I drink 1 sachet of BodyKey meal replacement, it can last me for a while. Is great to have it.

When I reached KM35, the time was 6:23am, 52 minutes ahead the cut off.

Can see the view along the way is quite nice.

Reached CP5, 1 hour ahead the cut off, not bad to me :)


But when I reached here, not much fruits left, so I just fill up some water and make Phytopowder to drink. It contains electrolyte‚Ä¶

9KM left‚Ä¶ Although is not long, but the final 5KM, my leg getter heavy, very hard to run already‚Ä¶4KM‚Ä¶3KM‚Ä¶2KM‚Ä¶ Then I met a 100KM runner, he also cramp already, so I walk with him until the last 500 meters, then he started to run! OMG‚Ä¶ I tried to run, but my calf & ankle kept sending me a signal, saying that if I continue to run, I will cramp‚Ä¶ No choice, I walk until the last 100 meters, then run to the finishing line XD

Mission completed!

Quite satisfied with my result :)

As I know I lag of training, but I‚Äôm sure I can do it better if have proper training.

Summary

I have a thought to sign up 100KM, but luckily I didn‚Äôt. Because this time 50KM is my limit already, I was quite tired on this race. So I sign up for 100KM, I think I will DNF.

So if the foundation is not strong enough, better don‚Äôt go for something unachievable. Foundation is very important, get more training!
entry.summary: I‚Äôve been rest a while from race after PBIM 2016. Thus, I have a

entry.title: Penang Bridge International Marathon 2016
entry.content:
This is my 3rd year joining full marathon in PBIM. The 1st time I completed in 5:08 hours, that time was running on 2nd bridge. Last year I completed in 6:23 hours, due to injured on my ankle, and lack of training. This year, my finishing time almost same as last year.

Early morning 9am+ I already reached the collection counter, that‚Äôs why not many people there.

My lucky number A00383

See what I have prepared‚Ä¶

Injinji socks. Because the 1st time I join FM, my toes feeling pain after some distance. This sock separate toes so that it avoid the problem.

A newly bought compression pant. I bought itduring the BodyKey event day. Quite good!

It‚Äôs always good to spare some cash & phone. Because to me, I can‚Äôt feel safe if without cash üòÜ

I like this headband very much, it‚Äôs soft, and it prevent my sweat come into my eyes. It‚Äôs Compressport brand

10 years ago, people run with a normal digital watch with a basic timer. Nowadays I see many of athlete wearing a GPS watch.

I also using this to estimate my pace in order to complete before the cutoff time (COT).

Well, I can complete within the COT without much training, I think mostly is because of Nutrilite!

Here are Double X, Salmon Omega 3, All plant protein, BodyKey meal replacement & phytopowder orange.

You can reach me on my Facebook page and PM me if you want to know more.

My friend told me that his knee feeling a bit pain before the race start. But he is showing the OK sign (see his right-hand), that means no problem ü§î

So many people joining FM, can see that FM is not as hard as you think üòâ

My stomach was not feeling well after around 8km, this was the same mistake I made last year ‚Äî‚Äî eating too much before the race‚Ä¶

Same like last year, I started to walk after 8th km. Walk-run-walk-run~ feel like want to vommit also, very uncomfortable.

Until going up the bridge, it was 18-19th km, my stomoch feeling better at that time. But feeling sleepy and leg muscle start feeling pain. I think this is because of not training well.

Getting less and less people here, because most people already running in front, and we‚Äôre left behind üòÖ

After digested my dinner, it‚Äôs the time to re-fuel with protein & BodyKey.

Yeah!!! I also prepared Phytopowder orange 2 sticks. Around 26 or 27km I drink while running/walking, that moment my leg muscle was tight. Until 30 or 31km, my leg feeling relief. Phytopowder is so powerful!!! I think is because of electrolytes, it‚Äôs very helpful.

This is the time to come back from the other side of the bridge

A lot of people walking slowly, and me too

This is intersection point with 10km runners, suddenly become so many people.

In the last 3km, I saw the 6:30 balloon coming from my back. Omg, my target was to faster than last year, so I keep pushing myself without stop running (the pace is around 8min/km+-). I really wish the balloon man can stop running for a while, because my leg very tired already. That moment has an evil-me & angel-me fighting in my mind. No choice, still have to push, I told myself: persist 1 more km, I can do it

Woo hoo!! At the end, I follow the 6:30 balloon man cross the finishing line. 06:31:33 when I take this photo.

Mission completed!!! again‚Ä¶

This year we have different size of medals ‚Äî‚Äî S, M, L. Obviously, S is for 10km finisher, M is for 21km finisher, L is for 42km finisher.

Another friend of mine, also completed his 2nd FM.

Remember the red-tshirt guy? He told me his knee pain. Guess what? He completed in 5:40++ hours. And this is also his first FM.

The pink t-shirt guy is running HM, hopefully next year can see him in FM.

After the race, I have Nutrilite protein for my recovery.

In that day, I have total 64k+ steps, almost same as last year.

Summary

Back in year 2014, I was so excited when I completed my first FM. Now, this is my 3rd times, before the race I already know I sure can complete within the COT, so the excitement level is not that high.

I believe everyone has a target to pursue. Just like 3 years back, my target was 42km; now, I‚Äôm looking towards ultra race in 2017!

You can have a meaningful life if you have a dream to pursue üòé
entry.summary: This is my 3rd year joining full marathon in PBIM. The 1st time I completed in 5:08 hours, that time was running on 2nd bridge. Last

entry.title: Into The Woods Night Trail 2016 - 13KM
entry.content:
My lucky number~

After I register for this race (alone), I was actually looking for some friends go with me. After asking a few friends, only she agree to join me.

But before that, she was afraid that she can‚Äôt make it. Because of is at night, some more in trail. I keep encouraging her, at the end, she signed up for the race!!

She‚Äôs so excited before the race‚Ä¶

Now get ready to run. About 600 runners (according to the organiser)

Completed in about 2 hours. This is not a very good result to me. As I very seldom training these days (can check it here).

There are quite many up& down hills, and running in the dark is much more difficult as compare to morning. Need to be very alert, otherwise may lost in the forest, because the road inside, some time suddenly need to turn to small road which is quite hard to notice as the surrounding is so dark.

What‚Äôs make to be able to complete in a not too bad timing? Of course I must give the credit to Nutrilite. The cutoff time is 3 hours, and I used 2/3 of the cutoff time to complete. To me, I think consider ok already.

She also finish in about my time, and I‚Äôm a bit surprise. Because before that, she told me is hard, nervous, not sure can complete within the cutoff time or not, and so on‚Ä¶

Now I learned, if someone tell you that s/he cannot, is not s/he actually cannot, just s/he underestimate him/herself. If you‚Äôre the one think that you cannot, believe in yourself, because‚Ä¶ YOU CAN DO IT!!!
entry.summary:
My lucky number~

After

entry.title: King of Sungai Lembing 2016 - 50KM
entry.content:
What makes me join this run?

At the beginning of 2016, I wrote down some resolution for this year. One of them is to complete an ultra-marathon. Any marathons that more than 42km are consider ultra.

The moment I really get the mood in was, after I completed my first Triathlon, then I immediately survey for any ultra run which around 50km to 60km.

My first choice was, Cameron trail run 60km, unfortunately by the time I want to register already full. Then finally I chosen KOSL.

A day before the race

Preparing items for the race. Before this race, I not training actively, like 1 or 2 weeks run 10km only. So I‚Äôm quite nervous for this, at the same time also excited!! As I‚Äôm going to complete 1 of my 2016 resolution.

Item I bring:

  • Sun glasses
  • Hydration pack
  • Blinker (is not really necessary here, because the race started at 7am)
  • Some chocolate (in case hungry)
  • headband

During the race

So it‚Äôs a trail run, 30km+ is off road

Cross the first river, this river must walk carefully, so that the shoes won‚Äôt get wet.

The distance is getting far between runners

Where to cross? In fact, my shoes get wet here! Initially I was thinking whether or not to take off my shoes and walk over the river, but I saw everybody just cross like that, then I also follow‚Ä¶ WET

This is the first water station which has food, coke, 100-plus, but no cup is provided‚Ä¶ I just bring a bottle with plain water, so if next time any of you want to join the race, please bring 1 more cup

This is the main checkpoint for 50km runner, must reach before 1pm, otherwise will be DNF. I reached here around 12pm.

Meet first buddy

Take a selfie while resting :)

Eventually become 4 buddies, and they are really awesome~

Speed up‚Ä¶the last 200 meters.

Yeah!!! My first 50km

The result

48km+ is because we skipped the scenery hill, due to safety issue (raining that time)

  • Category rank: 48/69
  • Overall rank: 88/121
  • Finishing time: 2016-08-28 15:47:38
  • Total time: 08:47:38

What I learnt from this race

A few items are needed for this race

  • Cap (because the weather will be hot, so a cap can cover eyes & face)
  • Extra 1 or 2 pairs of socks (I cross the river and my socks wet, I have to use it until the end of the race, what if it is 100km?)

Practice fast walk. This is learn from an experienced runner Rambo. This is because most of us (may be not you) cannot run non-stop until the finishing line, so walking is 1 of the key skill to survive until the finishing line. So, walk more‚Ä¶

Find a buddy if you‚Äôre not a podium runner. This is a mental game, some time walk with someone is better than alone, at least he/she can encourage & motivate you. Also can get to know a new friend.

Conclusion

Even I‚Äôm less training, but I do keep my diets, at the end still manage to complete within the cut off time.

If you thinking to join for a full marathon or even 50km, I encourage you to register first, then training later.

If you need my help, you can pm me on my Facebook.

Thanks for reading
entry.summary: <h3 id="What-makes-me-join-this-run"><a href="#What-makes-me-join-this-run" class="headerlink" title="What makes me join this

entry.title: Penang Triathlon 2016
entry.content:
This is my 3rd time sign up triathlon race.

The first time was on 2015, Penang Triathlon 2015. That time I borrow a very old mountain bike (break system also not that good) from my uncle, borrow helmet from a friend. Is like, not well prepared and just go for it. Unfortunately, on the event day, after check in my bike, I fell down and get my ankle injured. At first, I insist go to the swimming side, and try to swim a while, but was too pain, so I give up the race. My first time to give up a race‚Ä¶

After rest for 6 months, I sign up Port Dickson Triathlon 2015. Thought this time I will complete, but too bad, that time was hazy, and I withdraw again.

On the same year I bought a road bike, and some necessary equipments, then sign up Penang Triathlon 2016. Then‚Ä¶

This time I came alone, stay on 1 of my relative house, in Sungai Ara. The event place is on another side of the island. So need to wake up early and go to the place.

First, of course check in the bike at the starting point.

Then there is a shuttle bus to send all participants to the swimming area, I think around 2-3km.

First time swimming in the sea, the key is to cool down, don‚Äôt get panic. Because when I started to run into the sea, I felt my Qi is not enough and used up easily. After a while, I keep calm and slow down, is getting better. Swimming part is 2 loops triangle, each ~750m far.

After swim, by right should be cycling section. But this is different, we have to run from the sea side to starting point, around 2-3km.

Then the hardest part is cycling (to me). May be is because of I not get used to cycling, some more the route has lots of uphill & downhill, but is a very awesome experience. I almost cramp at first 5km of cycling, then I get down and rest for a while, and continue‚Ä¶ Total distance 40km, go 20km, then U-turn 20km. The challenging part is after U-turn, a long journey of uphill, but I don‚Äôt have cramp feeling anymore.

The final part is to run 10km. Although 10km is not long, but I walked a lot, instead of run. Met a new friend there and he walk/run together with me, so we finish almost the same time.

During my run, was heavy rain, that‚Äôs why whole body get wet.

First triathlon completed in almost 5 hours. To me, I‚Äôm satisfied with the timing, because I‚Äôve no proper training for this, and still completed within the cut off time (5:30 hours). And compare with last year.

I already better than myself last year.
entry.summary:
This is my 3rd time sign up triathlon race.

The first time was on 2015, Penang Triathlon 2015. That time I borrow a very old
